text:
First off we run a restaurant here locally, so we know the trials of food service. I hate to say it but we are critical about our dinners out, nothing sucks more than a shitty meal period! On the level of service: because we eat in bar always this is only the bartenders. The female bartenders are totally by far better than the male. And sorry matt but the only reason for my tip was the food. Bartenders should socialize with patrons, here's a phrase to learn " Hows your day/night going"? a little chit chat goes a long way. The ladies are always attentive, friendly, and smile.  

Now the food: the food is the reason we eat there a lot, twice this week actually. The chef must be newer because the food is far better than before. Unfortunately I'm terrible with names so without that I can't say who cooked our entries but who cares if they are that good! We found a little gem the wedge salad. G's wedge salad (lettuce wedge) spanks any wedge in Vegas. Del frisco's needs this wedge. Simply put amazing, try it you'll see. so two thumbs up from us keep up the tasty food, good portions, and so on. ciao bella

I have been coming here for lunch on weekdays for years now and the service is always what keeps me coming back, not to mention the Italian dishes are all very good.  On a side not, I also love that they separate the smoking section off so you are not dining in a restaurant full of smoke (like in most other sports bar/grills).  
The salads are all very good choices especially the antipasto salad.  And did I mention portion sizes... they are huge so I almost always end up taking some home for a quick dinner later on.  Enjoy!

I always go here when I suddenly get hungry late at night. The full menu is available 24 hours a day. The food is good and reasonably priced. The caprese pizza is my favorite. The bartender is very friendly and helpful. The only thing bad thing is that last time he forgot to give me my bread!
This is the worst place ever! The food is basic and the bartenders think you owe them. They stole my money as I went to the bathroom and insisted that I left it for them on the bar! Beware!

We have been going here and getting delivery for 5 years. My home is in mountains edge, 4.78 miles per mapquest. They say they go 5 miles but won't go on the other side of blue diamond. 

We get delivery at least 20 times or more a year. Per them we are "great customers" when I called to complain that they won't deliver any longer. Yet they still won't deliver. 

Get your delivery from anythingyouwantdelivery.com. They actually honor their great customers and have sent delivery drivers on holidays to deliver for us!

We will NEVER go back to Giuseppe's simply for honor. You don't screw over a great client who raves about you. Because your GPS says it's 5.1 miles and mapquest says its 4.78. 

I go back to restaurants who LIKES their patrons!
Smoker friendly. Terrific Italian menu. Good food, good service, nice decor, sports on 4 televisions. Excellent value.

This place is the king of lies! How can such a descriptive menu, that baits you
into ordering a bunch of food, yield results that make everything taste like semi-warm, grey matter? I ordered the "Big Al's Stuffed Sandwich" and it might as well have been a cotton ball soaked in grease. My buddy got the "Prosciutto Panini" and it tasted exactly the same, this also applies to the wife's "Cajun Chicken Sandwich" and "Stuffed Hot Peppers". It made me hate the fact that I have a mouth and no one in my party ate more than 2 bites before deciding to toss it out. The food is bad and you should feel bad!

The Pizza's are what you'd expect from an Italian joint. Everything tasted fresh and done well!  The crust was not soggy, nor too crusty, and salty! Don't know too much about the pasta, maybe on my next trip there! 

Ok selection of beers, but then again I would think the wine selection is better. 

Chin-Chin
Last night I was dining here and I had the best pizza in town.. Love their thin crust. Will go there again soon:)

Love g's!!!! Actually doing a live yelp now ( on a roll!!!) been here once before but don't yelp until at least second visit.... Amateurs yelping out there gotta give a place a chance only being somewhere once.... Duh!  Anyway last time dined in and server Ryan was a sweetheart and steered us in the right direction (huge menu!) lotta cute guys workin on the west side!!!! Jordan also helped us and was like the cutest little button you have ever seen! Sooo sweet!!!! Even the chef Rodrigo came out to make sure me and my bf liked our meal.... Rustic pizza was da' bomb and the antipasto salad was as big as beyonce's booty but tasted waaaayyyyy better! 

Came here again tonight and tested the bar staff.... Wow! Wow! Wow! The 2 bartenders Deanna and Liz are smoking hot but are so kind, genuine and knowledgeable about the food and bar I don't think they know how pretty they are when they look in the mirror! Jeez wish I had the looks and the works like these two have together!  Had delish house sliders, calamari, and drinky poo's to die for!  Even hit me a little 5 spot to pay for the night with a phat tip for my girlies takin care of me and my man! Stayed for a night cap with Mike grave bartender who made us laugh and was a genuine ole' school tender' who is on his game for working those tough hours :( 

All done and said u have to come here and revel in the beautiful decor (and staff) enjoy a game on the numerous tv's and just kick back.... Relax .... And eat hometown Cleveland little Italy eats!!!! Love u guys a++++! Ohhh and happy hour 4-7 pm everyday...drinky poo's and yummy apps!

I'm unable to review this "restaurant" as I was never even offered a glass of water, much less a chance to order food!! We sat at our table for over 20 minutes and no one even acknowledged us!! Several employees walked directly bye without so much as making contact. We got up and left and the only person who did offer us anything was the owner after we explained what had happened!!! Too little too late and out the door we went hungry and angry!!! Don't waste your time!

I was out with my family searching for a nice Italian meal but didn't want to drive all the way to Maggiano's.  Now whenever I visit an off strip restaurant I have two criteria that they must meet to achieve 3 or more stars:
1. It is equal to or better than Sizzler 
2. The service is decent enough where I don't have to wait more than 5 minutes at a time for my server to return with a refill etc.

Fists off my 4 year old wanted saut√©ed mushrooms instead of a meat ball on his kids spaghetti, the server said she couldn't do it and it would be a $3 up charge. I could imagine that mushrooms were cheaper than meat until I tried the mealy, grainy, over worked, flavorless turd that they put on his plate. 

I had the hot wings which were clearly fried from frozen considering the menu says it takes at least 15 minutes for them to arrive and I know how long it takes to cook chicken.  They weren't bad and the sauce was decent with out too much vinegar. My 5 year old had the kids chicken parmesan which was surprisingly large but lacked flavor. The same with cavatelli meat sauce my girl friend had.  I am shocked by how little basic seasoning they use. I think the only salt in the entire restaurant is on the table. There was none in the pasta water none in the sauce and certainly none when the meat was cooking.  Honestly I could make better Italian food on a camp stove.  

I think the bottom line is I am so sick of being let down by Italian. I hate signing my fifty dollar check and thinking to myself how I could have gone to fazoli's if I wanted a shitty meal. 

Thanks for nothing Giuseppe's,

I have been going to Giuseppe's since they have opened. This is a great family run restaurant that provides great service and great food. We feel like family every time we walk in the door. My wife and I even had our wedding reception there. They were very fare on the price and provided great food and great service. They made a very special night that much more special.
I can't even give this restaurant a star.  Well maybe one for service. But the worst food I have ever eaten     Cannot pass for Italian. Heavily fried and no taste.  Even the bread was bad
Yum! It's comfortable, quiet, and the food is DELICIOUS! Definitely worth my money and sure enjoyed my dinner!

I have no idea why this place doesn't have at least 4 stars. I ate here my first time and absolutely loved the experience. 

The host was very friendly, the waitress very sweet and informative and even the manager came around and asked me and my party if we were found well. 

The food itself was delicious. I started with their soup of the day which was the parmesan potato soup. Yummy creaminess! Then I ordered the chopped steak for my entr√©e. The may was good but the sauce with the onions and mushrooms was so savory. Pair that with some sliced fried potatoes and grilled zucchini.. unbelievable for only $10! How can you beat that quality for that price!

Dessert was by far the best part of the meal. My party and I ordered the tiramisu, brownie cheesecake and a slice of the lemon coconut cake so we could all kinda share. I could have ate all three because they were so good. On top of that, the portions were huge. I love any 4 layer cake that takes up almost the entire plate and is made so deliciously. 

Thumbs up and I will definitely be returning since their kitchen is conveniently open 24 hours.
Coming from Hawaii this is da best italian food in Las Vegas.. Da food was da ... We had all da appetizers n that was it cuzin... mahalos 4 da gr8 svc..  Aloha Fuentes Ohana...

Came in expecting this place to be like any other of the hundreds of pubs scattered across Vegas. We were surprised that this place is clean, has great food and excellent service!

The calamari appetizer was perfectly cooked and the marinara sauce was delicious. The angel hair pasta dish was fantastic as was the Trio Macaroni and Cheese!

We were especially impressed with the service. It was busy in the bar and there were only two waitress/bartenders working. They were both attentive and efficient and never missed a thing, even refilling our drinks before we asked!

We will definitely be visiting again very soon!
Bartender sees me walk in but no greeting. Waited about 10 min but no service so I left.

Kind of like Olive Garden meets The Old Spaghetti Factory. Not bad but, not terribly good either. There was only 3 tables of guests (small parties of 4 or less) in the dining room, yet our waitress could not remember who ordered what; including my water and his iced tea. The lasagne (which I was craving) was not as good as Stouffer's. His? We both can't even remember and it was last weekend. Also, appears to be a cop hangout!

Horrible, precooked, sams club quality chicken patties for the parmesan and marsala. Service is good but food is NOT homemade.  Anyone who thinks this is "good Italian Food" should save their pennies and go to any hole in the wall Italian joint in NY ...the shocking difference might kill Ya ! 

Sauce - out of a jar 
cheese - fake
I could go on

The one Positive is the staff is super nice, too bad they have nothing to work with .

Judging from the exterior of this place you would never know that the food is excellent!  Quite surprised and pleased on finding this little gem.  We came with a party of 6 people and all of us were very pleased with our entrees and service.
Been to this place a few times.  Pretty decent place.........BUT DO NOT ORDER the NY style pizza.  Some really sad s@**. See pic

Went in for food and sat at a table in the bar. Waited almost 20 minutes before getting a menu. Meanwhile, the bartender was standing back chatting with customers and watching the game. We were in clear view and find it hard to believe that they didn't see us. This is not the first time this has happened. We ended up leaving thinking we would wait 5x longer for drinks and food. I thought this establishment was different, but it seems they only prioritize customers in their bar who are willing to throw money in their machines, which don't pay out either. Place needs better ventilation too. The smell of smoke is that of a 30 yr old casino.
the food is amazing, from the chicken finger to the pasta. I love eating at the bar they are extremely  nice. and on top with refills and checking in on you . highly recommend  this place to eat .

Open 24 hours. Bar is sealed off from restaurant so the smokers won't be relegated outside. Nice touch! I have eaten here many times and have never been disappointed. My favorite dish is not on the menu but if you ask they will make it for you. Chicken Piccata with grilled zucchini and homefries. You have to say it just like that, otherwise you'll be sleeping with the fishes. The calamari or the pizza quesadilla appetizer can't go wrong. I keep there business cards in my car so when I hear a friend may be traveling to Vegas I hand them a card and tell them just say CatDaddy Ralph sent ya. It's nice to get away from the strip and feel at home. That is what is great about Giuseppe's. OH and the other thing they pour a stiff drink which helps you spread those gamblin dollars.

Not a huge fan. Food isn't bad but service isn't great. They posted a Sunday special and when I called to order it, it was a big long process that it shouldn't have been. Didn't appreciate the lack of customer service and the pizza was only mediocre. I ate in the restaurant once and also had bad service so I'm not impressed.

The food here is ok. We have eaten here several times and the food is hit or miss. They have really good macaroni and cheese balls and a sausage and peppers appetizer that was delicious. The chicken Marsala though was not very good. The sauce that is on it tasted like gravy. Also the service here is very slow.

Bad service. Food is ok. Water tastes like crap. Management interrupts table while they serve guests. Forget beverage orders with 2 tables being served. I've been here a half dozen times and I'm never impressed.

My husband took me here on one of our many dates....I was very pleasantly surprised by the staff how nice, kind, and attentive they were. Service was fast and the food....oh my God needless to say one of the best and my favorite. To the point that when we got married, we had our reception there. 
Staff was outstanding and the food for our wedding, well people till this day talk about. 
I can't mention just one thing, try their dessert, the tiramisu is just amazing. 
We come here all the time, especially on our anniversary.

Positive - Good food. Try the Cran Feta Chopped Salad and the Cappellini Pomadoro! Friendly staff. Good for take-out. Open 24/7

Negative - It's a little on the pricey side for what it is.

Always love coming to Giuseppe's. Delicious food and awesome service! My favorite item is the Cranfetta salad, which I recommend to anyone. We also love going to watch baseball games with Jordan and Derek who are bartenders there.

The food is good but the staff lacks. I ordered some food to go on Tuesday at the Anthem Highlands location because it was 2 for 1 Tuesday after I placed the order they told me that they won't honor the deal despite it being on the menu that they not only sent me in the mail but gave me the week prior.  Even after I told the
 That they just honored the deal last week when I ordered from them.  They just replied sorry we won't honor it.  Needless to say we went elsewhere.  Not a good start to your new location especially for being in a small community that talks a lot about the service at the local restaurants and stores.

Honestly been here 2 times and the food is amazing but the host is never at the host stand we had to wait over 10 minutes both times and the first time my sever was fantastic he was attentive and my tea was always filled but the 2nd time I went there the server we had wasn't great the busser filled my drink and asked how everything was and my server only stopped by to get the s check and drop off our food. So the food amazing but the service is just so so.

Although the food is awesome here it is as expensive as a any high quality restaurant for being a smokey bar. They charge you an extra $2 for their "home made" blue cheese dressing. ( it's a very small container that's hardly enough for a salad). Also the service is horrible. If your going to put these prices, go to someplace like Nioras where you get more for your money, amazing food and great service.

Giuseppe's is our go to restaurant. Never been disappointed. They have a 7 day a week happy hour. 4-7(I think). Rarely do you see weekend happy hour. Discount drinks and apps. Lately we have had the all you can eat fish. Crispy coating and fresh. What I like most, is their prices are reasonable. Classy but casual.

If you are looking for a local place to hang out for a game with great food and drink specials this is it! $2 fire ball and $2 PBR! Enough said there and to make it even better $5 one topping pizza! The servers I have had the last two times were awesome and very quick as well. Thank you for the best pizza deal in town!

My family and I all LOVE eating here! They have such amazing, delicious food!! The chicken parm is excellent. By far once of the BEST I've had. This is coming from an Italian woman who grew up with a wonderful grandmother who made outstanding Italian food from scratch and an amazing mother who makes ANY type of dish a 5 star cuisine!!  

So needless to say...if we love it here then it must be awesome food.

Came here for lunch with a friend. We ate and drank at the bar. They have the ubiquitous gambling machines but not at every seat, so patrons who don't want to gamble don't necessarily have to stare at the incessantly blinking things. Ha. Good food, full bar, efficient bartender, music at a reasonable volume, clean bathrooms, reasonable prices. I would come again.

Just tried this place and it was awesome loved the Giuseppes original pizza and chicken parmigiana it was delicious I would definitely recommend this place to anyone and I will be eating here more often

First of all we waited at the host stand for 10 minutes without seeing a host.  This is a typical problem for this restaurant.  The dining room was full so we asked to be seated in the bar.  After 5 minutes a server came by to tell us that she would be right with us.  That was fine, but after 10 more minutes we still had not been waited on.  So we finally left.  The food here is good but not worth the terrible service.

An updated review is long overdue.  Since my last review in 2009 I've been to GBG at least five times.

 tend to stick to the basics - spaghetti and meatballs, lasagna, chicken parmesan, etc. 

Service is always prompt and friendly.  They have decent happy hour specials and daily food specials.  

If i'm in the mood for working class italian, this is my go to spot. 

pic included
Great spot!  Nicely done - loved the Mac and cheese balls!  Thanks Brittany - great service!
Top quality service, food and atmosphere. I just can get enough of this place. Anything I order is alway top notch, even the salads (which I'm now hooked on).

My wife,I and a good friend came for dinner with average expectations. Upon arrival the place was very busy serving a large table (party) of 20. Even though the place was way packed I felt that our service was still good. 
   We ordered appetizers of mozzarella sticks and garlic bread which came out very yummy. I could tell the mozzarella sticks were homemade. The garlic bread could have used some more garlic but it too was good. I ordered a supreme pizza, which came out hot and very tasty No complaints.  My wife got the eggplant Parmesan which she said the eggplant was the best she ever had, but she stated her side of pasta did not taste that good. My beers were cold and glasses chilled. Overall I enjoyed the experience. I will come again.

I ordered the gnocchi with vodka sauce which was really quite delicious. I also ordered extra chicken (seven small strips) but they charged me $5.99 for that??? I got a side salad and they also charged me $1.99 for the dressing.... That was absurd. But I also ordered the lemon cake and out came this BIG ass slice of cake which was yum. Also the bartender was really nice.

I worked in an italian restaurant for 6 years in HS and College... a mom and pop shop.  Private family recipes from the homeland, the whole thing.  The food here... as far as authentic italian goes... doesn't work for me.  The sauce is too watered down... reminds me of Chef Boyardee.  But then again, i believe italian is a personal thing and some might like it that way.  As far as bar food... they are one of the best.  Their meatball sliders are to die for!!!  So... it's all about expectations!  The gambling is ok... i had the longest losing streak here but broke it this time with 4 queens so I feel better about that.  Give it at try... see if it's your style or not.  The portions are good and the bartenders and servers are nice...

We usually go to a little bit more upscale places but since I had eaten here for lunch wanted to come back with some friends. On  Saturday evening can be pretty busy around 630 to 7 but slower later.I called ahead and we got a booth. The service was outstanding. Derek was our waiter and we couldn't have asked for better. There were 4 of us. We had the eggplant parmesan , chicken parmesan , spicy shrimp limoncello was fabulous ,  we also  had the antipasto salad and side of Italian sausage. It was delicious !! Very good Italian sausage.  We  got  a bottle of Ruffino Chianti for 32 bucks. The chocolate cake was great and you've got to try the cran feta salad! We had to bring a bunch of food home because they give you a very large portions .we were really surprised at the quality of food. Then for all 4 of us including the wine plus a an extra glass or 2 the check was really reasonable. Just try it if you like Italian food. They also have a delicious seafood salad. We are definitely going back.

I wish I could give this place no star. The parking lot was packed for a Thursday night. We immediately went on a waitlist which the hosted stated 10-15 but was obviously longer no complaint, I get it. We were sat as well as a large party. Mind you there were only 4 of us. We waited 20 minutes patiently. Wasn't greeted, wasn't acknowledged, nothing. The large party was greeted and was served drinks. We ended up walking out. My mother went to the front to say we had not been seen or at least told it would be a minute. The woman up front was so rude I had told her she could have at least acknowledged that we were talking to her. She didn't look up from wiping her menus(glad you know how to do your job). My father spoke to the manager and had told him we were waiting for 20 minutes with no service or greeting. This had been his second visit with the same situation and he thought he would give this restaurant another chance. My father said should we stand here and wait to see how long it takes for this table to be greeted, the manager said I thought you were leaving. Another large group that had just been sat was getting ready to leave as well. Worst service ever. I have been working in the service industry for awhile and I know for a fact there is a 5 foot 10 foot rule. I'm so disappointed in this restaurant and will not be returning. It's a shame too, their food looked decent.

Place is in the middle of nowhere. If you're a health conscious the wedge salad is not the choice but tasty, too much cheese. The burger looks good. If you're hungry, it's a good enough place but if you're a foodie and health conscious, not a choice. It's good for a try.

Ordered pasta with clam sauce,one of my favorite foods. Was served pasta with yucky cream sauce that had already coagulated in the bowl, 2 bites,and pushed it away. Hubby had beef on weck, it was a wreck. Service very slow, and it was not busy. Will not return.
Delicious food. Family owned restaurant. I had the chicken mozzarella pasta dish. The waitress, Jordan, was so cool and welcoming. I'll definitely be coming back in the future

We definitely should have tried this place sooner!  Very nice ambience in the dining room...cozy and comfortable. The food on the $10 special menu was great (overall). The bread that came out was warm and tasty. The add on salads were pretty big and totally worth the $2. The balsamic pork chop was awesome (the house potatoes weren't the best though). The chicken parm was delicious and cooked really well. The chicken marsala was wonderful, although the portion of chicken was a little small. The only thing lacking was service...the drinks took a long time to come out and the servers weren't very attentive, which was shame. (When it's not busy customers shouldn't have to ask for refills on water.) We'll be back though! Can't wait to try some more specials!

A carry out experience that might as well have been dining in. I called and ordered a pizza the other night. For carry out. They told me 20-25 minutes. I was there after about 18 minutes. I was told it would be a few minutes; not a big deal. I had expected that because I arrived early. At 41 minutes post phone call, I still didn't have my pizza. The bartender (who was nice and the ONLY reason I'm giving two stars) offered me a free dessert to make up for the time suck. At 51 minutes post order, I finally had my pizza. I might as well have sat down and dined in. However, the reviews on this place with the terrible service doesn't bode well. The pizza was sub par and certainly not worth the ridiculous wait. Also, I find it really annoying that I had to stand in the bar to pick up my order. So I got to breathe in everyone's foul cigarette smoke for 30 minutes. Why can't you pick up food with the hostess?  I won't be back to see if changes are made. If you have 6 hours available for your dining experience, this is the place for you!

When you own and work at a Bar & Grille one can understand how difficult that may be, but please don't loose site of your clientele.  The food, overall is good and mostly homemade, which is a plus.  But I am always disappointed by the bar staff...it seems that I am always an inconvenience to them.  I could understand long wait times if the place was overflowing with people but when you are one of four at the bar...really?

I'd heard good things about this place, but it still took me a while to try it. now I wish I had earlier. 
I was sat immediately and the waitress was over within a few minutes. When I said I was interested in wine the waitress suggested I try somethings different than what I was looking at, and then she brought out samples of each for me to try. She was spot on in her recommendation/ It went perfectly with what I was ordering where as what I wanted first off would have been too much for my food.
The food was great and the ambiance was perfect, slightly darkened restaurant with music playing in the background, but with sports on the monitors in the dining area.
It was my first time there and I was made to feel like I was a welcome friend.
I ordered the chicken Ricatta with a salad and a Merlot. With the bread and the salad, I was not looking for desert after I finished. Fortunately it is not much of a drive, because I am going to be coming back regularly.
It was thick with cigarette smoke, my order showed up late from the rest of my party, and the eggplant lasagna I ordered was seriously cold in the middle. :/

My boyfriend used to live right next to this place and we would go here all the time to see Matt the graveyard bartender. Even though we live much further now (like Losee and Ann kind of far) we still try and make it over there as often as possible because it is so good. Also, Matt is just such a wonderful guy, we mostly just come for him. 

Their food is amazing. Before I went vegan the Mac n cheese balls and their cheesecake were my JAM! 

My boyfriend also loves all their salads, pizzas and burgers. Since I've been vegan I like to get their roasted vegetable platter. It is an appetizer but trust me it is a lot of food and can count as a meal. Just ask them to put the balsamic on the side, sometimes they can lay it on pretty thick. 

Overall looove this place. Even if you don't drink or gamble, come for the food!

I love coming here! The food is consistent and so is the service. I love dining in, but usually I just get takeout on busy week nights. Either way, the food never disappoints. They have something for everyone.
I live right down the street from here. My family and l always bring out of town guests here.best food around this area!

Used a groupon to test this lovely establishment and so glad we did. The inside on the place is a lovely setting and the food portions huge. The wings take about 20-30 min because they are made fresh...yummy! We had the chicken parm, amazing, and gnocci. Gnocci was ok, not the best or worst ive had. Service was excellent and we look forward to eating there again!!!

I honestly can't say enough about the food here. If you leave here hungry or unsatisfied, that's your fault. The service is great. If you're from NE Ohio, this is a bonus for you as they show the Indians, Browns, and Cavs games here. It's not just chicken tenders, wings, and burgers. This place has authentic Italian cuisine. I recommend the Cran Feta Salad.
Don't order for delivery here. Quoted 30 minutes and an hour and a half later still no food. Called and wanted all my info again when I asked where's my delivery. Total joke!!

To get a large pizza and you can count the pieces of pepperoni on two hands I felt cheated and then I asked for light sauce and get so much sauce that the cheese and what little pepperoni on the pizza slid off

We were a party of six coming in 8 PM with no reservation. My wife and I shared the stuffed talapia and the chicken cacciatore. The talapia was the better of the two dishes. The fish was tasty and the stuffing was great. The chicken cacciatore was a nice sized portion with chicken and pasta with vegatables. Very tasty! The other four in our group had a similar experience with their dishes.We will be back.
Great Food and service.  Our waitress Maria was great in helping our picky party order the best food .

Really wanted to like this place more.  Nice booths, pleasant server, great salad (two bucks extra but very good) - wonderful bread... But entrees were so-so.  Tasted like reheats covered in sauce. Temp of food should have been hotter... the eggplant did not taste as fresh as it should have.  The sauce was just OK.  Italian is all about the sauce and it was just very average.  Really expected better.  Eggplant/chicken parm were just OK.   Also, never got refills on water.  Wish the entrees were as good and their salad.

More than meets the eye! This place looks deserted whenever I drive by (pretty dark, rarely any cars outside) but it's a 24 hour place that actually puts out pretty decent food. Inside bar area is actually pretty nice, menu has Italian pizza and pasta as well as typical bar selections.

Opted for a soup of the day (minestrone) and an order of wings (Italian: garlic and parm) to go, both were good and portions were well-priced. Total for a bowl and 8 wings, shared meal for two, was $15.

Service seems to be hit or miss- older male employee I worked with was pleasant, female bartender was smoking behind the counter and totally ignored me until the gentleman helped me several minutes after I entered, kind of a turn off to returning but I am not opposed to grabbing takeout here again.

Pasta+chicken+mushrooms= $21. After seeing the reviews here about the anglehair, blush sauce with chicken and mushrooms looked amazing. Upon receiving it, it had maybe half the sauce as the examples pictured in the reviews so it was pretty dry, included 8-9 small slivers of mushrooms but the chicken was decently seasoned. All in all it was ok, but even olive garden would be better. The real shock was the bill, this dish was tied as the most expensive items on the menu (seafood dishes and the largest pizza) at $21, thinking it was a mistake I mentioned it and they confirmed it to be correct. The service was very friendly but after being utterly ripped off for such a simple dish, there is no way I will ever return.

Holy crap! Great specials on food and drinks, casino gambling, and amazingly friendly and comfortable bartenders pretty much sums up my visit here last night. I've got to say they have a great price points and I was very happy to know that they were open 24 hours. Diana was a great bartender and not too bad on the eyes either. If you crave anything from pizza and pasta to burgers and chicken parmigiana, you need to come here! Come here people!

Restaurant is alright. Good steak, ok pasta and nice warm bread with butter to greet you.
Waitress in flip flops. HOW? Really?
Delicious homemade Italian recipes! Nice lunch and dinner specials :D

I went tonite for dinner. First time at this restaurant. I was immediately greeted with a nice smile from the hostess and also a fantastic smile from my waitress Yessi. The food was good. Yessi's service and attitude was superb. I will be back.

Okay. I can't begin to stress how AWESOME their pizza is here. After a night of drinking, my friends and I were craving pizza that was nearby. This bar is about 5 mins away from my apartment. So we order a large pepperoni and sausage pizza. It came hot and fresh in a huuuuge box (we thought it may have been an extra large by accident, lol). And I swear to you, everything about it was perfect. We even got it the next day when we were sober to compare it to our drunken night's experience. 

Would give this place 5 stars except... we received terrible attitude and bad customer service via telephone order and felt we were being rushed.

Absolutely awesome...l ate at the one in Henderson now l live near this one. Had a fabulous New Years Eve dinner loved the food the atmosphere this is my come to restaurant now. The same bartender that was at the Henderson one was here he even remembered us l didnt catch his name but he sure is personable. Had a pizza from there last night it was superb. I am having a house warming party l am going to have them make the food for me.

Good food, moderately priced.   Great homemade soups and salad dressings.  We have never been disappointed and eat there fairly regularly.  If you go at happy hour, they have great prices - excellent calamari. Recommended.
This place is alright.  The food is okay, and the drinks are fine.  The bartenders are generally very good, however.  The price is also about on par for a local bar in Vegas.

After having dinner elsewhere, a friend and I wanted to have wine and this place came to mind. Wine drinkers......come on Wednesdays because all wine is 50% OFF.  The server helped us choose a red wine. We went with 2013 Red Diamond merlot. It had been a rough day at work so we ordered a bottle vs just a glass. We polished off the bottle in no time while catching up. We sat in the restaurant area. Atmosphere was chill and quiet. Even though we didnt eat, their menu has plenty of italian food, pastas and salads. I remember eating here about a year ago and the food was pretty good. This place is open 24/7 and 5 mins away from my house. Im sure Ill be back in the future....most likely on a Wednesday.

I had high hopes for this place but overall it was a wild disappointment. I've been searching for good pizza in this city and have been disappointed by every place besides Grimaldi's and Settebello. I came her a few weeks ago after I had been told that they were known as being great pizza. 

Food - I have to say the food was wildly boring. The server also didn't point out that I was ordering a HUGE salad when I ordered the ceasar before my pizza. I also had asked if it was served chilled, which she said yes. That wasn't my idea of chilled but I guess we all have different definitions. I ordered their appetizer pizza/flatbread. I'd go into detail about it but it was so boring I only remember thinking that the only reason I was eating it was because I was really hunger. There was nothing memorable about it and definitely not worth coming back for any time soon.

Service - This had to be the worst service I've had in Las Vegas. It seemed to take forever with little communication. Maybe she was looking for menus for a bit but you could tell me that instead of having me wonder what is going on. She also had little personality. I sat there for quite a LONG time waiting to flag her down and get my check, while I watched her bitch and gossip with the other bartender forever. She didn't even seem to pretend to look around and see if anyone needed anything. I tipped 15% which is LOW for me. 

All in all I see no reason to go back . The food and service both left something to be desired. I suggest driving down to Grimaldi's or going to The District and have Settebello

I had the best lunch ever! Their salads are amazing! 

We sat at the bar, so the service was extremely fast! Good prices too!

When you first walk in the cigarette smoke is overwhelming. Not really a smell that influences an appetite. The service was fast but perhaps a little too fast because our pizza tasted like it wasn't cooked quite right. Maybe I'll give it another chance eventually but I'm doubtful. The management should really look into some more ventilation for the cigarette smell. That was probably the worst part of the experience.

This is one of our favorite restaurants in Vegas. We absolutely enjoyed this restaurant. The service is always  fantastic, as  this is a family owned restaurant. Absolutely fantastic food and great service. We highly recommend it!

Came in trying to order a vegetarian eggplant pasta to pick up for my boyfriend; I found out they just ran out but Diamond was such a great hostess and was quickly able to find a vegetarian alternative. She was so friendly and courteous, I was beyond happy she assisted me  

Thanks Diamond! My boyfriend loved the Eggplant Parmesan  

Place looks amazing, will have to dine-in next time!
The pasta is just okay but really nothing to write home about. The cheesecake was good and as "Forest Gump" would say "that's all I have to say about that".

Moved into an apartment nearby and against my better judgement decided to give it a shot...BIG MISTAKE.
We walked in around 10pm and asked if the kitchen was still open. The hostess said she didn't know but sat us anyways. Took three tries just to get a water. We ordered a plate of Gnocchi Vodka and some garlic bread....our order came out way too quick and I knew we were in trouble. First off, the sauce was RED not a Vodka sauce and when I asked the waiter if this was vodka or Marinara sauce he assured me that it was their Vodka sauce but that they didn't use a lot of Vodka which is why the sauce was red instead of pink...say what??????.....it's cream that makes it pink!!! The gnocchi were badly undercooked making each gnocchi the equivalent of a hockey puck. Well at least there was some garlic bread...NOPE...the bread tasted fresh out of the plastic bag...they had melted slices of some sort of unidentifiable cheese. The meatballs had all the flavor associated with freezer burn.So basically the Pepsi was the best part...the only part I would suggest anyone should order from this dive. You've been warned....

Love the fettuccine Alfredo... Service is always great and easy take out orders!!

I like how the bar is separate from the dinning area so if people smoke at the bar it doesn't interfere with dinner guests.
The caprese was awesome!!!! The pasta wasn't bad.. but the caprese I love a lot..good portion

We ate here about a year and a half ago and went back tonight and it was really bad!! No taste to the sauce and lasagna was not like before. I guess they got a new cook but we won't be back!! 
Patty T Las Vegas, NV

We ordered the pepperoni giuseppe's pizza and I literally could only choke down a slice. I'm not a fan or any of it. Sorry I have nothing nice to say. There was maybe a half a cup of cheese on the whole large pizza and like 15 of the tiniest baby pepperoni slices. Total rubbish. 

 I haven't found a good slice in Nevada at all. A lot of pizza places say "New York style" but I've been to New York and have had plenty of pizza plus I'm originally from the East Coast and New York style pizza is awesome! I have yet to find a pizza place out here that can hold a candle to even the shittiest pizza on the East Coast. The search continues...

Had an amazing dinner tonight.  The service here tonight was outstanding.  We had roxy for the first time which Ryan is our normal server but is gone for school and she I can say did an over the top job tonight.  From start to finish we enjoyed everything.  Even got us signed up for a rewards card for every time we dine here.  great personality and very outgoing.  Definitely will be coming back to see her. THANK YOU ROXY!  JOB WELL DONE!!!!!!!!

Great restaurant and amazing servers!  Dezarae is the best!  She makes every Wednesday night special and goes above and beyond to keep us coming back.  They also cater many of my events.  Joe was amazing.  He helped set everything up and made sure everything was perfect for our event!

We ventured over here to meet some family for lunch. The one thing that is odd from an outsiders view of Vegas is how many places just sprout up in the middle of nowhere. Vegas has been growing so fast that things just develop next to the roads, sometimes all by themselves. This is one of those places that's just surrounded by dirt and other stuff in the distance. That doesn't take away from the fact that I found this place to be pretty good. 

The deal/hook? Five dollar lunch specials. Yeah, you read right: $5! I ordered the linguine marinara sauce. It was actually really good. The sauce focused the tomato flavor very well. It was thick, but smooth on the pallet. The one negative is that is was kind of small. The fianc√©e had a salad. It was in a large bowl AND included a small bowl of soup. She was unable to finish it all, plus I ate some of it. Now, that was definitely worth five bucks!

The service was very attentive although we were there at a time when the restaurant was pretty empty. No reason to think it wouldn't translate over to busier times though. They were very friendly. The medium sized parking lot wraps around the building, but there shouldn't be to much trouble finding a space.

A unexpected dinner out after work with my gorgeous wife to an Italian restaurant. Great food , service was good, a little slow but not a deal breaker. The food was fantastic, atmosphere very Italian once you get past the front door and see the bar and gaming area.

The bartender/server is the most gracious, helpful human being I've ever encountered in the service industry. He smoothed out a small complaint of mine with grace and genuine concern and was just the most professional and amazing human being ever. I can't even deal right now. Also the food is A+.  And the desserts are HUGE and succulent. I love how there's a huge selection.

I'm surprised this place doesn't have a higher rating, I eat here a couple times a month. It's hard finding a good plate of gnocchi in this town but they got it down to where it reminds me of my grandmother's homemade dish. The portion is huge in my opinion and i am always bring home left overs.

The only dish I am not particularly fond of is the pizza, but I am picky when it comes to pizzas. 

The house white vinaigrette is amazing and they sell it if you ask them. 

Overall, I really enjoy this place and you can't go wrong with their Tuesday appetizer special.

Happy hour here is only once a day between 5-7. Wish it had a late night happy hour too. This is a nice place but the food is not too casual, it is very delicious but more of a sit down and have a classy bite... not bad at all but very good quality to enjoy.
Great wings, and bartenders remember what we drink the second time we came to visit, my husband and I like it here!

Nov. 8, 2017. Second visit. Special shout out to our server - Nick F. - who was amazing! Great customer service. Friendly, courteous, and prompt.

We ordered the Italian Antipasto Salad with romaine lettuce, salami, ham, provolone cheese, tomatoes, roasted red peppers, and olives, served with homemade Italian dressing. Whoever said salads are bland haven't had Guiseppe's.

The lightly Eggplant Parmigiana with melted mozzarella cheese was right on! Served with linguini in pomodora sauce. I didn't want to share.

I've never had Cavatelli Di Casa but it's one of my faves now. Pasta dumplings with bite sized meatballs in homemade tomato sauce.

5 Stars for Guissepe's for food, service, and ambiance. A definite go-to for fine dining.

My son and I stopped in here for lunch.  This establishment needs a lot of improvement.  The service is OK, not bad but nothing special. Just servers going through the motions. The food is mediocre at best. Myself and my family all being "in the industry" you come to expect a certain standard. The sauce is seriously lacking. It tastes like Prego or something bottled. Its not horrible but its lacking and forgettable. There are so many fine establishments in Vegas and this is another forgettable place. If you are reading reviews to find a place there are plenty of other places that are far better.

We have been regulars here since we moved to Las Vegas six years ago, but tonight we hit a new low.  Our server was obviously struggling to handle her tables.  We had bread but no beverages for at least fifteen minutes.  We had to ask two different people for our drink order and then it was brought in stages.  We got our salads shortly after, but then waited over twenty minutes after we were finished with them to receive our dinner orders.  My steak was over salted, and the shrimp scampi was definitely not scampi - it was grilled shrimp coated in season salt.  The mushroom risotto side was the saltiest thing on my plate.  My hubby got lasagna, which he usually loves, but only finished half.  My mother in law got cold chicken parmigiana.  Then we sat and waited - and waited - and finally our server came over to see if we wanted the check.  The leftovers were taken to the back to be boxed up and brought out ten minutes later.  It was a very disappointing dinner from a place that used to be one of our favorite go-to's for dinner.  Sorry Giuseppe's - I think this is our last meal here.

Let me start by saying we are a traditional Italian Family.  
We never ate Italian food out (except pizza)
because we couldn't find homemade (not modern, or fusion) excellent Italian food, but now we have. 
Everything we have eaten here is very traditional, and made as if your Nona cooked all of Sunday afternoon.
We have eaten Lasagna Eggplant Parmigiana , chicken Marsala, spaghetti and meatballs , penne pasta with roasted vegetables, chicken wings, and in my opinion the very best pizza in LV , my lettuce wedge with blue cheese dressing was a half of a lettuce a meal in itself.  
Everything is A-1 . 
Go with time to enjoy the camaraderie that comes with having a family meal.
Great service, large portions and tasty food!  Family owned and the owners help in the food prep.  Other family members involved in serving.  A labor of love!

Some of the worst service I've ever experienced. When they sat my party of four, it took the staff 15 minutes to figure out who our server was. Once that was finally decided, she told us she "forgot" to bring us our drinks on a refill because she had a party of 6 in the other room that was just sat and she had to tend to them. 35 minutes later, once we finally flagged our server down again, they brought our food to us. 

The food was pretty good, but once we finished eating, we couldn't find our server for another 20 minutes and then had to take the bill to the bar and find someone there to cash out. 

The bar area was not packed with people, so we were very confused as to why the server couldn't remember to come back, or at least send someone else to check on us. 

There are far too many other options in this city for sub-par service. I won't be returning!

Very fresh & tasty food ! Great service & very clean ! Very nice atmosphere nice soothing lighting  & comfortable booths ! 
Will definitely go back ! Loved their happy hour time too!

We went there last week and the service SUCKED big time.  The hostess pointed to the dining room and told us to seat ourselves, she was busy on a personal call.  The server took 10 minutes before he touched our table.  He waited on two other tables first even though they arrived AFTER we did.  When the bread was delivered, seconds later we noticed ants crawling on the bread from the ants that had been crawling on the table.  The restaurant was dirty and looked like it hadn't been cleaned in forever.  I will NEVER go back there!

Ok I know I said I wouldn't come back but its been 2 yrs and so I decided to try this place again, why not right??!!   well let me just tell you , I loved it, the food was excellent, the service great, warm bread, yesssss the way it should be and guess what they had cappuccinos. we really loved it we even made our Mother's day reservations here .

Food is okay here.   Ate here for dinner with a friend once, and then a business luncheon.   It's not the greatest place, but it's rather reasonably priced.

Part of their lot is gravel so you'll have to be careful if you're coming in off the side street.

My husband turned me on to Giuseppe's from having one of his vendor's take them here for lunch.  He had the $10 lasagna.  Needless to say, he was so full from the smaller $10 portion (as compared to the Mama D's portion $14.95 enough for two people+leftovers) but, he just couldn't stop eating it.  He shared this information with me and from there, we made our way to Giuseppe's about a week or so later.

We went on a Tuesday night.  On Tuesdays, they offer buy one get one free appetizers and desserts.  The dining room was packed, but did not need to wait for a table.  ALL of the staff were working hard to accommodate hungry diners.  The bartenders even came out of the bar area to refresh drinks and run food.  I could see the staff were slightly overwhelmed but, they all seemed to keep their cool.  It did take a little bit for our server to come to our table but, we totally understood the stress level he was going through.  

We order...BOGO appetizers, why the heck wouldn't we try more!  We ordered the garlic bread and mozzarella sticks.  The garlic bread should be avoided unless you like unbuttered, crunchy, boring bread.  The mozz sticks were a different story...  They were homemade!  Mozzarella hand-rolled in bread crumbs and fried near perfectly.  The marinara (homemade) on the side was very good too.  These are definitely worth trying!!

Since we ordered two Mama D's lasagnas, house salads were included in the price.  Salads were a nice appetizer portion with fresh romaine, chick peas, black olives, mozzarella cheese, croutons (store bought), and delicious dressings (we omitted tomato).  I had the white balsamic vinaigrette and the hubby had the Italian; both were delicious and homemade. Added brownie points for serving the dressings on the side.

At this point we are full or are fools for eating so much.  We grind on to our Mama D's Lasagna.  Wow!  The tomato sauce is very good because it is plain but flavorful (clich√©?).  The lasagna itself has no sauce in the middle of each sheet; only a pork/hamburger mixture, or cheese.  Somehow, it works because even though you are already full, you keep stabbing your weary fork for more, and more, and more...  Several times during our entr√©e course my husband says to me, "Are you gonna stop picking?"  10 stabs later I ask for a box.  

Fools are so full.  Remember, it's BOGO desserts too on Tuesday.  We order two of them to go :X.  We order the brownie cheesecake and strawberry shortcake.  Both were very good and worth ordering many more times.

Preface:
Giuseppe's is a 24/7 gaming bar/restaurant who get trivial reviews for some of their food and service.  But with that, the lasagna is some of the best I've had including Piatti's in La Jolla.  The mozzarella sticks, house salads, and desserts compare to some of Vegas' top restaurants. As for their other dishes, I cannot vouch for them yet.  Please try the lasagna!  Service is not top notch as others have mentioned but, when it comes to good eats, I'm more than willing to wait; good things take time...

Came here for late night craving of Italian pasta and this place was PERFECT! We ordered Chicken Parmigiana and Rigatoni Italiano with extra side of Caesar salad and the food was absolutely delicious. The serving sizes are pretty big so it's worth the money. The Caesar salad was great as well. Service by the guy behind the bar was excellent, he refilled drinks and checked up on us a lot. definitely would recommend!
I've never had a bad meal there. One of my favorite spots to eat. The Cran Feta Salad will blow your mind.

My friend and I went in for lunch on Nov 16,2012 about 12:20. The hostest was very nice and she sat in a nice booth. The dining area only had two tables occupied when we got there. 

An elderly waitress barely greeted us at our table,she didnt smile , her attitude was blah.She gave us water, asked what would like we asked if she could come back in a minute. She never came back to our table ,she proceeded to take orders and waited on  two tables that sat after ours.

I told my friend lets go some where else  because  I dont like to spend my money at places that dont want my business. As we were leaving the hostest asked if we were leaving we said yes and she "because the waitress didnt serve you"  . This must have happened before or quite common with this waitress.

Oh by the way my friend and I are college graduate, successful business men, home owners ,fathers , husbands,live Henderson,NV , oh and we're also African American!

I would suggest if you're are a person of color , I would recommend another place to eat because Giuseppe does'nt  want you or your business.

Before I get into the meat and potatoes of this establishment, I want to be completely fair and state that the food is decent, which is why this is a two star review.  Unfortunately, their customer service SERIOUSLY leaves something to be desired.

Last night I called in to this location to order a pizza to be delivered.  I couldn't remember which phone number I had originally used that had all of our information and the woman on the phone was audibly irritated by that fact.  Actually, she informed me, "it would be much easier to figure out which number you have on record so I don't have to re-take all your information."  Are you kidding me?

When the phone numbers I gave her didn't show up, she finally relented and asked for my last name, which is a fairly simple last name.  She couldn't get it and treated me like I was speaking a foreign language.  After she snapped at me, I feigned a lost connection and just hung up, intent on ordering a pizza elsewhere.  Just to reiterate, during that entire conversation, she had only received phone numbers and a last name...no order was placed.  That, however, didn't stop her from calling three of the numbers that had been given to her several times.  That aggravated me.  You'd think that since it was so inconvenient to have to deal with me over the phone that my hanging up would have been a blessing to her.  Is it because she didn't get the last word?

I won't be back.  I don't have the time or patience for an establishment that acts annoyed by my patronage.

Not sure. Walked in; place looked semi-deserted. Sat down, waiter brought our drinks, then 20 minutes later we left without ordering. Seems like a depressing out of the way place now that everything else has been built up so much around it. Again, a sad state of affairs in the local economy.

Went to this place today. Thought I would try the soup and salad for 7.99. When I ask if they had blue cheese dressing they said yes then I ask if they carried French and they did not. I do not eat ranch or balsamic. When I placed my order with blue cheese they said we charge 1.00 for the blue cheese. Okay you probably think this is petty but I use to own a restaurant and place that on the menu don't give me a surprise after I've already decided. It's the principle. I was told "we make it from scratch. We're famous for our blue cheese dressing". That's good, if you are famous then you should have greater traffic in and out and don't rely on blue cheese dressing to make you rich. I didn't order anything. I drank a soda and my friend ate. I'll never go back.
Food was excellent. Brittany the server was good and the management was attentive. Definitely coming back

I live about 5 minutes from this restaurant and went there for the first time 2 weeks ago and fell in love with the food. I have been back to the restaurant 4 times in 2 weeks. I love the anti-pasta platter, fried calamari, chicken saltimbocca, and so much more. If you are looking for great food, great portions at a low price Giuseppe's is the place to go.

I received a menu advertisement in the mail.  The menu looked good so I thought I would order for delivery. I ended up ordering for pick up and the food was 5 star restaurant quality but without all
The hassles of sitting down at an exclusive restaurant. We ordered the meatball sliders, blue cheese wedge salad and fettuccine Alfredo with two meatballs.  I can't wait to try more things on the menu in the near future.

Good price for beers during happy hour. Good atmosphere. Pizza was okay, not worth the price. Then again it sat for over 20 minutes before being brought to our table for take out. The bartender did offer to have it remade, however, we had run out of time and couldn't wait. Pizza box was cold so that shows how long it sat. By the time we got home we had to place in oven to warm up. Will try again in the future for Italian fare.  Menu looked good and reasonably priced. Staff was friendly.
Great spot for happy hour. Upscale bar food. Good draft beer selection. I always sit at the bar and service is always good

Food and service were great. The fried Mac-n-cheese balls were amazing. The chicken parmigiana was excellent. The cheese tortellini with pesto alfredo sauce was very rich and tasty. Unfortunately we were far too stuffed for dessert.
Poor service, rude customers at the bar, lousy food, and absolutely nothing Italian about this place.

I was craving Italian food and this gem is on my way home so I decided to stop in. I was alone so I sat at the bar. The staff was attentive and friendly. I had a side salad, which was your typical side salad. Nothing extraordinary, but the lettuce was crisp and they didn't skimp on the cheese. I also had the lasagna which was great. A very generous portion with great flavor. Lots of sauce and cheese. I'd definitely try this place again.

I just tried to order pizza and salad for delivery.  The woman who answered the phone put me on hold more that once and then when I gave her the address she told me I had to have the building number.  I told her that I have had pizza delivered here many times and never needed the building number.  I was trying to explain to her where the building was located and she interuppted me with a "well, gps doesn't give the building location".  I was trying to tell her.... but I will take my business and money somewhere else.

Good food, Great Service, Friendly staff.

I have been here multiple times and it has always been awesome

This place has certainly gone down hill!
We were rushed through our meal....the waitress asked us if we wanted dessert while I was eating my meal...literally had just gotten it.
Bread isn't fresh and hot like it used to be....sauce for pastas were bland.

Had another great meal...we sat at the bar. The ambiance is cozy and dim. Nice televisions playing sports. I always build my own pasta: half marinara/ half Alfredo, chicken,  mushrooms, tossed in angel hair. Yum! 

Their bread is so soft- must dip in balsamic vinegar & olive oil. My husband had a wrap with fries which he said was very good. This is a great place to eat at bar or in dining room. Staff always helpful and good rewards program for gaming.

They have great wood fire pizzas..drizzle garlic and its magic ( just don't breathe on anyone for two days)!
Food is great. Service is awesome Mike treats everyone like they are celebrities. Drinks are top notch.  Food is awesome.  I will always spend my free time there. You all rock!!!!!

We walked in and everything seemed very clean which is great. But the customer service could use some work. Had to ask for water refills and condiments for the pizza we ordered. Overall pizza we ordered was delicious! Next time we will order to take out.
We had dinner here and shared the anti-pasta salad and the bacon wrapped barbecued prawns.  Both were excellent.  This was our first visit here and we will definitely be returning.
Awesome food. We had the NY style pizza and mozzarella crusted chicken delivered. A little expensive, though.

Lunchtime Buffet- 8.95 includes drink. Mon - Fri from 11:00 until 2 or 3:00 PM. I saw the sign and kept it on my mental checklist of spots to check out. We finally hit up Giuseppe's this week and it hit the spot. A choice of salads, soup, variety of pizzas, pasta, and a couple of main courses. We were there for the pork chop or sausage. I tried neither I work outside and it's too hot for that stuff.
 The salads were really good as was the pizza. The bowtie pasta wasn't al dente and the sauce was kinda yuck. 8.00$ and it's totally worth it.
 The joint's motif is Italian and sports the staff is friendly and super efficient. I got a glimpse of the Giuseppe burger and it was kind of huge I will be back for that.

I ate here with a large party and this place was amazing! The service was great along with the food. The bread was great nice crust. I had penne and added grilled chicken which was very tasty loved the veggies. The salad was excellent too. Great experience and I would come back.

Sometimes the services is slow with seating and serving. The food is really good. I always recommend the chicken chopped salad. My wife loves the Italian Wedding soup. My suggestion is order for pickup or delivery.

My mom & I went here last night & the food was absolutely delicious! The one thing I didn't like is it's also a bar/grille so it has that smoking stench that I'm not a fan of felt like a PT's or Lodge. The bar/smoking area is closed off & dining area is separate. Very small dining area & it was very busy, not an open table which wasn't a bad thing. We waited about 15 minutes before we were seated & customer service was great the entire time. Even with how busy they were. Food is all homemade. I got the lasagne & was not disappointed at all! So good! I will be back.

I never expect to get great food from a gaming tavern and Giuseppe's met my expectations. My first time here was back in 2007 when my real estate agent brought me here for lunch. It wasn't until recently that I returned for a second visit. The place is spacious with a dining area full of comfy booths and a bar area that's enclosed to limit smokiness throughout the place.

The menu is large and offers just about everything for lunch and dinner, plus there's a kids menu too. The chicken noodle soup was decent. The wedding soup was similar to the chicken noodle soup with the addition of meatballs. The garlic bread, on Italian bread topped with cheese and sauce, was pretty tasty and a good sized portion. The gnocchi was way too dense and thick. The kid's order of chicken fingers was of the typical frozen variety.

Came here for lunch over the weekend and experienced slow service at Giuseppe's. The waitress was not very attentive.

After we ordered our food, we were relieved that we didn't have to wait a while. The meals came promptly. I am a pretty big fan of the Caesar salad! Seems to be one of the better Caesar salads I've had in a while. The tortellini el pesto was also pretty good. The portions seem decent here. The chicken was a good size. It came with red pepper strips and tomatoes, but the sauce was way too watery! Almost like soup. When I added grated cheese to it, it mixed well and became a nice consistency.

All in all, the prices were very reasonable and the portions were large, but the quality missed a mark a little. I will definitely consider giving this place another try. I wouldn't be surprised if they exceed my expectations!

The food here is pretty good. I usually go when I am craving their lemon cake. It's so good and if you catch it while it is fresh it is the best!! They are also known for their meatball sandwiches. If you don't mind the smoke and the bar environment, the food is pretty good here.

great dinner last Friday night.  Pizza and Tirimasu were awesome!
Service is always friendly.

Come to happy hour and dine at price of 1 star restaurant but 5 star ambiance and 5 star foods.  What a good valued restaurant. They play oldies music that's not too loud with very friendly staffs. My second time here and thank god they haven't changed anything. It's good for date nite restaurant

I'm not sure if this should be considered a complete review, but I'm a really big fan of this place. I've only had the chicken tenders with BBQ sauce, the fried mozzarella, and the French fries.  All were 5 stars! The service is very good as well. They are open 24/7 and that is really convenient for a person who's up late. 
None of the items that I ordered were frozen. That's kind of a big deal to me.

This was my first visit and it was a lunch meeting with two new business associates.  One frequents Giuseppe's a lot for business lunches.

It was pretty unassuming on the outside.  The inside is the same.  It was fairly quiet so that's why it was selected for a quick business lunch.

I have to say... best Chicken Marsala I have had in Vegas yet.  (and that's my "go to" for Italian food)  The chicken was super tender and not overcooked.  The pasta that went with it was absolutely perfect.

Service was quick, friendly and unobtrusive.

I will definitely go back.

This is the best Italian place in the southwest area.  The prices and service are good and the food is excellent.  Fresh ingredients and good portions.  Where else can you get 2 dinners at a nice place for $40 or less?  Here.
Best pasta and pizza ever. Very nice ambiance, waitress Ruby was on point. Will definitely be going back.

Used to come here a lot for good food and quiet atmosphere but one that last visit the server spilled wine on me and although he was very apologetic, did nothing to compensate for my being soaked in red wine. Didn't expect a free meal, but could you comp the wine I was wearing?! Won't be back, that was a deal-breaker.

I love this place but last night on the 4th of July I was very I pleased with my service. The bartender got my salad order wrong then when my pasta come out wrong the manager said he would fix it we where there for almost two hours waiting so I got it Togo and the manger said I should have ordered it right insted of saying she got my order wrong. Must be a new manager bc I have never seen him. Just not a good experience

My husband and I both love their food there.  Their Mama D's Lasagna and Chicken Marsala are excellent.  Also big fans of the wedge salad and Italian bread.  We dined in only once but we order carry out several times a month making this place one of our local favorites for Italian!

believe me when I tell you - this place has incredible Italian food. so much yasssss!

thoroughly enjoyed the drinks and the service. the bartenders are great. everyone in there is so attentive and nice! I didn't have to stress about my glass being empty because they were on top of things! 

where do I even begin on the food? this place is all about quality! my twin and I were absolutely starving decided to order two dishes each and shared them together. 

Mr. G's Hoagie - the hoagie was stacked with meats and it had that true classic Italian hoagie taste to it. soo good!

Chicken tenders - these babies were on point! not overly breaded or fried. I could have eaten a hundred of those and still not been tired of them.

Insalada Caprese - mozzarella was so fresh. they even included a small arugula salad with some olives and artichokes. it was like 2 salads in one. awesome.

Rigatoni Italiano - homemade sauce had peppers and sausage in it which gave the dish an amazing hearty taste. we devoured that dish dry. 

if you don't know, now you know. definitely will be returning often!

My job had ordered catering from here for our Christmas party and since then I've been wanting to try here again. I came here for lunch with some of my coworkers and was pleasantly surprised! The decor and atmosphere of Giuseppe's was not what I was originally expecting. I highly recommend their chicken Parmesan lunch special! They give you quite a lot for what you pay for. I had ordered to go and was so happy that they even included bread and butter with my order! I will definitely be coming back again!

Amazing food! I've visited 2x now, & the food is amazing,  even the chicken fingers are home-made & not frozen before cooking. The meatball sliders were delicious! I could tell those were freshly cooked too! Bartender was a busy body, and nice as well. They are 24 hours, & all food items are available 24 hours, I highly recommend this place for food!

I came here for lunch on Wednesday and it wasn't busy.  The decor was nicer than your usual sports bar and had an Italian feel to it.  There were probably 2-4 other tables being served.  The service was great-- our waitress was helpful and friendly.  We were offered a sample of the pork and cabbage soup; the soup was flavorful and the pork was really tender.

The menu was pretty extensive-- salads, soups, pastas, pizza, fish, sandwiches, burgers. They had lunch specials ($7-9) along with a page of $10 specials.  I really didn't know what to order because there were so many choices!  It also made me a little nervous of which items are actually good.  I ordered the pan seared tilapia off of the $10 specials.  It came with pasta and sauteed baby spinach. I was hoping the sauce would be more clear rather than creamy, but I loved that they were generous with the capers.  The tilapia had a nice crust on it but had sort of a muddy/earthy taste to it.  I wasn't too concerned because tilapia sometimes tends to have this taste

http://s3-media4.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/CrVSGXEBTklHdTOoEt1vuQ/l.jpg

The salads my co workers ordered looked pretty tasty.  The antipasta salad came with cured meats and the caesar salad came with a whole grilled chicken breast.  Another co worker ordered the wrap, but the wrap looked small with the huge pile of potato chips that came with her order.

Overall, the service was great , the restaurant is clean and the food wasn't too bad.

24 hour Italian food! 

Giuseppe's has great food, great service and great specials. I actually have to stop myself from coming here more often because the delicious pasta is just not conducive to keeping my waistline in a respectable range. 

The entrees are anywhere from $5.95 up to around $20 and the portion sizes are generous. Save some room for dessert. They have a cart they bring around to tempt you into getting tiramisu, cannolis, zeppolis, carrot cake, chocolate layer cake and other such delights. THE TIRAMISU IS ABSOLUTELY DEVINE! 

It seems like every night there is some sort of special: i.e., Monday night 5.95 steak special, Tuesday night: 2 for 1 desserts or appetizers; Wednesday night: Free bottle of wine with entree and Thursday night half off alcohol from 4p-11p. Also I heard on the 2nd Thursday of every month there is a wine tasting. I will have to try to catch that. 

Next time you find yourself with an Italian food craving, I highly recommend Giuseppe's.

Absolute worst customer service I have ever had in Las Vegas Nevada. If you're in the industry business you know you EARN your tips by actually paying attention to your  customers, sat for over 30 Minutes minutes waiting for the bartender to come and service us and then he charged us overpriced drinks even after gambling $$$. Do not recommend this bar for any industry employees!!

We arrived at 6:57pm yesterday, there were 7 adults and a baby. We were told it would be 15 minutes bevause a large party was just finishing up. No worries, the large party left about 10 minutes after that.  We then proceeded to wait another 20 minutes, all while being told they were just putting the tables together multiple times by both the hostesses  (who seem to be capable of nothing but wiping menus down) I proceeded to walk back and see that all the tables they were supposedly pushing together were still covered in dirty dishes and food. I asked the hostess if they were gonna continue to lie to us or were they actually gonna clean the tables and seat us, I even offered to help clean the tables.  Her response was no were cleaning them right now,  as I'm looking at the tables nobody has touched for 20 minutes.  5 minutes later we were finally seated. 10 minutes later we get drinks.  We order and the the food slowly starts arriving, salads drenched in dressing and mediocre pasta and chicken parm. It was like pulling teeth to get the server to acknowledge us. At one point I pulled the manager aside and asked if he would ask out server to get us refills bevause I didn't want to interrupt his 15 minute conversation with his other table. Who btw were regulars that "once they get talking they don't stop". The place was full of excuses the entire night. From not having a sling for a car seat.  Which the hostess said they had then came back and said they don't have,  to no refills to finally getting out checks. It's now 9oclock. The icing on the cake...... the 50 year old male server then asked if he could smell my infants head while my wife was holding her.  Are you kidding me. I will never be back to this place and I'll never suggest it to anyone.

That about sums it up for me.  Meh.  It kinda is.  Went here for a teenagers birthday party.  It was a joyous event, especially for the guest of honor turning 16!  Laughing and dancing was had by all.  Decent place to have a party that's on the smaller side (around 100 people).

But the food was just on the average, nothing I could find as special at all.  The appetizers were bland.  Chicken fingers with ranch, and breaded calamari with marinara?  Not the greatest because they definitely were from frozen and not from scratch.  Soggy bits everywhere.

The party had a buffet with a spread of some of Giuseppe's offerings.  I have to say though, none of it was really all that spectacular.  It definitely rang in 'bar food' for me...but not great bar food that you can find in other spots and watering holes.  It was just unimpressive at Giuseppe's.

Their Italian Chopped Salad had romaine, salami, capocolla, zucchini, gorgonzola, tomato, roasted peppers, and red onion tossed in the hour Italian dressing.  This was ok, on par with what you would find in lots of Italian joints.  It did get soggy though as the buffet line passed since it was tossed in the dressing ahead of time.  
On the buffet line was also roasted potatoes, fresh mixed vegetables, penne pasta wtih Giuseppe's tomato sauce, and  breaded chicken breast with peppers and mushrooms in a wine glaze.  All average, and nothing you couldn't have made yourself in your own kitchen.  Although I will say that their tomato sauce isn't bad, I'm hoping that they use high quality San Marzano tomatoes in their sauce but who knows!  Chicken was moist and tender but was lacking in the flavor department, nothing robust.

I think the best thing on the buffet line was probably the pizza Giuseppe's put out.  These suckers were huge sheets!  And New York Style.  You know I loves me some NY style pizza!  I had slices (actually squares) of their cheese and pepperoni.  Pretty good!  Crust was thin but crispy, sauce was tangy and sweet, cheese was gooey, and the pepperoni was salty and oily.  I've had better pizza but this was a bit of a Godsend because the rest of the food was not so inviting.

Giuseppe's is open 24 hours a day so going in for a meal anytime isn't a problem.  I think their problem might be getting repeat customers if their food isn't on par.  They offer a lot of Italian specialties on their menu, but I don't think I will be going out of my way in the near future to get a meal here.  Most I would do is probably order a pizza for takeout!

First visit was last night for dinner.
I asked the staff for suggestions.  Cavatelli which was one of the featured items on the menu.
It was prepared with commercially compose frozen meatballs. What a disappointment! If I wanted frozen food that was reheated I could've eaten it home from my freezer.

The food was definitely 4-5 star, especially considering the price. However, I agree with previous reviews regarding the service. Slow as molasses, main entree was delivered before the appetizers; didn't receive a glass of water until the end of the meal. I think I'll settle for take out from this place.

I keep trying this place once a year and I never learn my lesson. Not good Italian food. Just go for a sandwich or burger. Tonight on 10/7/13 our server was poor. Prices have gone up too. Why???  Again just go for a sandwich.
I absolutely love the food! They have the best french dip sandwich and their pizzas are loaded with toppings. Really nice staff and pretty quick service.

This review is for the West Horizon Ridge location. Blch Blch.. I ordered spaghetti  and it was on time,, but they served me a giant dog dish of what we used to call left over spaghetti. You throw in what sauce you have and cover the spaghetti and than stir the pot of spaghetti,, its like a goolosh. That's how you serve it when you are poor.  So now I have a pound of left over spaghetti in a white dog dish. It tasted so bland,, there was no taste. I picked at it,, told them to put in a box,,  I took it home and thru some Ragu over it,, and than it was edible. Thanks Ragu... What ever happened to white spaghetti with a rich tomato sauce over it..?????

I said i would give this place a second try. I ordered a flat bread pizza,, well it looked good,, but the first crust and and about 2 inches were hard as a rock,, If I tried to eat the crust, I would have broken a tooth. I ate  the luke warm centers and paid my bill and left. 

 Forget this place. Chef Ramsey would have closed this place down a long time ago. 

They seem disorganized, and no quality control in their business. I like the name,, but that's all I like about this place.

A great lunch spot! A couple coworkers and I frequent this establishment often. Maybe because it's so darn close to the office, but mostly because its pretty reasonable and pretty darn good.

They have great food and for the most part great service. Only a couple of times have we run into some extremely slow service while eating in the bar area. Haven't run into bad food yet (knock on wood!). Normally we try to catch the two for one appetizers on Tuesdays, but they have such a big selection we can't resist on other days. My most recent selection was the cran/feta chicken salad and I added my own touch to it with blue cheese. The marriage of the sweet vinaigrette and the tangy blue cheese is just outstanding to me.
